alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Coastal Chatham; Effingham; Evans; Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 10:22PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, EVANS, LIBERTY, BULLOCH, EFFINGHAM, CHATHAM, LONG, TATTNALL, BEAUFORT, COLLETON AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 1022 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pocotaligo to near Pineora to near Reidsville, and moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Hinesville, Pooler, Bluffton, Beaufort, Port Royal, Richmond Hill, Reidsville, Savannah Airport, Pembroke and Ridgeland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: A severe thunderstorm watch is in effect. Thunderstorms can produce large hail, damaging winds and isolated tornadoes suddenly, sometimes with little or no warning. Be alert for rapidly changing weather conditions and be ready to act quickly if severe weather is observed or a warning is issued. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
